U6R_PJ71J6ifemltPEXpxg.text: aw i feel a bit bad that this nando's seems to have gotten some mediocre reviews.  i, for one, LOVE some nandos!  and this place was perfect when the boyfriend and i were looking for a late(ish) night bite to eat.    it was coming up to 10pm on a saturday night and we both were starving for dinner!  i was hoping something would be open along george vi bridge and lo and behold, the welcoming lights of Nandos!!  we entered and i was surprised that for 10pm this place was fairly busy.  however we were shown to a seat quickly and the waiter confirmed that we knew how the ordering system, etc worked.  at this point i don't even bother to look at the menu as i always order the same thing and i can confirm that the halluomi and portabello pita was just as good as it always is.  in fact it was probably better than usual as i was a bit tipsy and starving!  the coleslaw was tasty and the chips freshly made.  so all in all a really good meal for less than a tenner.  the boyfriend was equally happy with his chicken wrap.  i felt that the service was quick and attentive and honestly i can't think of anything negative to say.  especially as this place was still seating people when we left closer to 11pm!  yay for a proper late night meal :)

4yW3dLmjDkoDL2aShZGedA.text: very average food. wee burger, plain bread, coleslaw chopped in huge pieces and all that for about 8!!! bottom line - too expensive and nothing special.

dKwYpAHAQln4eOEVCxPmXA.text: NANDO'S!    Ordered the chicken leg non spicy with a side of corn and mashed potato. yuuuuuuum. I mean it is basic food but doesn't mean it isn't good. The chicken was nice and tender with delicious seasonings.   You order at the cash and it gets delivered to your seat.   I wish we had this chain in Montreal!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

bhwMLtZBW6pswpm6LNOeaw.text: Sitting here watching kids put their hands and faces on the plates and very near the unserved food that has been sitting under warming lights waiting to be served for more than 10 minutes. We ordered more than 30 minutes ago. No sign of our food. I'm trying to be patient, but I am hungry, mad about the kids breathing all over the food. Absolutely disgusting!

RuDgYS90NgQoaGr9NcPs3A.text: I really don't know how someone can not like Nando's!  They call it legendary peri-peri chicken for a reason!  Especially love their chicken wings. Service is fast and the food delish. I do wish they had bbq sauce but that's not their thang. This particular location is massive with cute decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

pP2S1ppL573k7y6MghV17g.text: Nando Nando bo Bando, Banana fano for Fando, Fe fi mo Mando, NANDO's!!  Just seems to rhyme doesn't it! Having been to the London locations and now in Scotland, I have to say they are consistent and do not disappoint.   What makes this place desirable is the Sauces which is the star of the plate. Poured over every bite of the chargrilled chicken is what keeps me craving and coming back. Staff was friendly, service was attentive, prices reasonable and location was next to the Edinburgh Castle.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

jArNPSrlxBQ2HX8UTPEfvg.text: I have been to Nando's a couple times after university lectures to grab some dinner with friends. I think their peri-peri chicken is amazing and such a delight to indulge in after a tiring or hard day.  My favourite thing from their menu is the fino pitta. This is what I usually get from there. However, my most recent experience made me a bit wary. Perhaps it was the fact that my group and I came an hour away from closing so the servers were tired and in the mood to go home? I got the fino pitta and so did my friend as we both are big fans. However, this time it tasted completely different from usual. I am not sure what they did to it but the sauce they put in tasted just like honey...something that did not go with the mix of the rest of the ingredients and made both my friend and I unable to finish eating it. The usual sauce they have on this is a garlic mayo sort of sauce which is a great finish to the wrap. Without that, the whole taste was ruined.   My other friends ended up ordering salads and were also not big fans. Perhaps we should always come way before closing because apparently it is not worth coming any later...I still am a big fan of their wonderful chicken but I wish they were consistent with the taste of their products.

avoIVaY5K7dNW7dKsrKTRg.text: We went here while visiting Scotland. Service was fine. It's chicken. It was good. We enjoyed it.

Id1W5MZzDNF23AOXZPIYqg.text: We bought 2 chicken legs and 5 chicken wings, all of which were burnt and tasted bitter!!! Maybe because know the reason that we take out, feel can deceive us! This is a huge cheat!!! This is my first time eating this restaurant and it will be my last time!! If you continue to cheat like this, sooner or later you will be finished!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xOXlET1_TEJ1nPS8Z9YBdw.text: Loved it! First time there and everything was delicious! The moment you open the door you can smell the delicious aromas of well cooked chicken. I got the pita with chips and my sister got 1/4 chicken with chips and their super food bowl thing and all of it was good even the super food thing with the avocado dressing was delicious! The chicken was perfectly cooked so moist and their dressing are great I loved the lime and herb dressing! Wish we had this back in the states

StDiN6IQv_YM1_QmkgUo2g.text: As much as I do enjoy Nandos I really cannot justify the cost, it's completely ridiculous.   Since its been a year I decided to stop by for lunch. This particular venue is very spacious with heaps of tables. Service is decent.   Same principle- get a table, order at the counter then go get your own cutlery and sauces before your meal comes.   So my order was the quarter chicken with two sides and my partner had the chicken wrap with a side of fries.   When my order came by heart sank, the chicken was not a quarter, it was more like 1/6 of the chicken which was just poor effort on their part. My partners wrap was child sized and we both were underwhelmed by the meal.   The two sides were grilled corn and Mediterranean vegetables- I was charged separately for them which I'm completely unimpressed by.   I guess I just like the thought of eating at Nandos more than wasting my money on half a meal that couldn't fill a child's stomach.   The food itself was good, but since it wasn't more than 3 mouthfuls I don't think I could elaborate anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

KGgjygJE7defHT_iuX-dUw.text: Nando's chicken is always famous. Went over because we are craving for some meat in this carbohydrate-rich diet.  We are a bunch of 9 and we separated ourselves into three groups and share food among the little groups. My group of 4 got a full platter with two regular peri-salted chips, a corn and the mash sides. Additional of a bottomless drink - share among the four.  The chicken was so nicely prepared. The sauces are really hot, even the herb or the garlic ones. Somehow I think the chicken goes better alone than with any sauces haha.  We four girls can barely finish the whole platter. It's huge and fed us all :)

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Full platter Regular sides: Peri-salted chips x2, corn and mash

g21W96I5pyHqEs-C1ro_gA.text: Food was as usual.  Service was horrible. One of the staff was unbelievably rude (the rest wasn't particularly nice either). First, she was very impatient when I was making my order. Asked for a glass for water later on and she made me feel like it's a crime to make her walk a few extra steps to get me the glass.   Self serving counter was almost empty - no knives, no forks, no napkins.  My coffee didn't come with sugar. No one was around and I had to go to the counter again to ask for it. Felt like they just threw us to a corner and disappeared so that we couldn't bother them anymore.   I had never experienced any service as unpleasant as this and I actually wondered if I had done anything wrong. This is from 5 months ago but still upsets me. Thanks for the unforgettable experience.   Have been avoiding this Nando's from then and go for the one at Omni Centre.

khxqcLWcwo5qXf6F9k2Asg.text: This is a popular franchise in the UK area. It's known for its great chicken, and it certainly lives up to its reputation!  A friend and I split a whole chicken with 4 sides and we were absolutely porked and satisfied. The chicken was tender and flavorful. You also have an option to add a wide array of sauces, which I'd highly recommend in order to tailor your chicken to your taste.  The service at the Edinburgh location is exceptional. I can speak to that much at least. Employees at the cash register were happy to assist with questions as my friend and I were first timers. Also, we got our food relatively quick.  My only negative remark would be the price. Expect to drop about 10 quid for a decent meal. Slightly pricey for casual dining, but the food is fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. no line survivors, meal was fantastic
Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. full chicken with 2 order of fries (chips) and an order of spicy rice and mashed potatoes

pwTMs9sPl36aJXQij-6XXA.text: First time eating at Nando's! It's not some sophisticated cuisine, but I appreciated my lunch there. The chicken, sides and sauces were good, and the staff was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Butterfly Burger, 1/4 Chicken

VvAjHHZ1M0hRVkF1FrjGpw.text: Call me a food snob, but whenever I overhear people making a big fuss over Nando's I feel a little twinge of pity for them. They clearly haven't had the opportunity to explore the range of truly tasty restaurants we have in the city.  I've tried to like Nando's. I've even given it a few chances to win me over, but the overwhelming response each time is 'meh'.   It's chicken and chips. My gran knocks that together most Sundays and doesn't charge a hefty mark up.  The chicken isn't even particularly moist, in fact it's more often than not grilled to within an inch of its life. The chips, if the internet is to be believed, are supplied by McCain (based on my visits I wouldn't dispute that). If you're excited to see halloumi on the menu, don't be, as you'll only be served a few teeny slivers. It's all just a bit mediocre. Bland, soulless food disguised by a heavy slathering of peri-peri spice and/or sauce - the trojan horse they've used to build the brand.  My top tip for eating at Nando's is... don't bother. Chicken, McCains, hummus, halloumi, and even their own sauces are widely available in supermarkets these days. Stay in, do a better job of the cooking yourself, and save your hard earned cash for somewhere with a bit more oomph.

1rQQwgZMpvuHqpSM211e4A.text: Nandos was constantly been one of my favorite chain restaurants with great food. The first times I visited this particular location I found the food portions a bit smaller than other restaurants, but I found that this has been improved. The restaurant has a nice ambience and is conveniently located.  I would normally give them 4*, but Nandos no longer holds the student discount they used to have.

Z03eohSywQHTKyliEL3lug.text: The food was good, but the service was so terrible I have to give only one star.  A member of my party waited nearly 30 minutes for a salad and a "starter" of wings. The self serve silverware bucket was out of knives and forks for quite some time. Finally, the napkin dispenser, arguably the most important aspect of a place that serves wings regularly, was empty for atleast 10 minutes.

PQej0gA13u1fdIdJcGaOlw.text: Me love me some chicken but somehow Nandos never appealed to me as somewhere I'd wanna go (if you can bring me my food, you can flippin well take my order). However, an avid card carrying friend assured me I was missing a trick. Unfortunately, she be wrong. Now I get the appeal, looks like a restaurant but it's not all stuffy like, prices not too steep, loyalty card, drink refills. But considering it's all up in yer face with the peri peri, I was left wanting. Pushed the boat out and went for some kind of platter to really get my teeth into my first experience but it was kind of bland for my taste buds. And even with the addition of copious helpings of their sauces I was left wanting. Certainly a step up from their finger lickin rivals with regards the decor but flavour wise, not my ting.

Rx1DpysPdEm5V-JqYW1pEg.text: Nandos was by far my favorite chain restaurant in Europe. The butterfly burger was amazing, as I had one in the London, Dublin, and Edinburgh location. A must have if visiting!

lmTbgpjQCz5LnGVubuxuew.text: I was SO excited to go to Nandos as I'd been years ago and had very fond memories.  I have to say though, I was sorely disappointed!    Although I have to say, I think it is a great idea how you choose your filling, type of meal (eg pita bread, bun, etc) and also the spiceyness of the sauce - the lemon and mango numbers are great for those would like flavour but can't stand hot and spicey!!!    However I just thought that for what you got (a glorified burger basically) that it is well overpriced.  When I went I ordered two main meals plus two drinks and I barely got a few pennies in change from 30?!?!?!  Now the way I look at it is for this price I could have gone to a pretty decent restaurant and would have enjoyed spending that amount of money there rather than giving it to a place that is just a step up from McDonalds.  In fact, considering I can buy a meal for two for less than a tenner in McDonalds I think I prefer it to Nandos!!!    Don't get me wrong, the food was good but so is a Big Mac from time to time so in the end it was just an expensive burger and I've had better!    I'm sad to say, my Nandos bubble was well and truly burst!

sk0WwUIXveSz035SHgjcXg.text: Tonight was the first training night at Nandos and all was well.   There's an upstairs so it's a large restaurant and plenty of space between tables.   Staff lovely and friendly. This is a great place to go if you want chicken, to be served quickly and know what to expect.   I like Nandos, it's simple if not formulaic but tasty food and I like to go there from time to time!  However, if you are not from Edinburgh, there a lots of lovely independent restaurants near by too!
